text: p16 overexpression is shown in most cervical pre-cancer lesions and cancers, but it is rarely observed in normal tissue.Co-expression of the antiproliferative p16 protein and the proliferation marker Ki-67 within the same cervical epithelial cell can be used as a surrogate marker of cell-cycle deregulation mediated by HPV oncoproteins.
